intro: Calydermos spilanthoides, commonly known as the spilanthoid dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, composite structure. Calydermos spilanthoides is noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
